page.title: 01TILEHURST
page.content: Tilehurst,a rapidly growing suberb of Reading built on the hill between the valley of the Thames on the north side of the Kennet on the south side. The roads leading up into Tilehurst are steep until they reach the plateau at the top.At the highest point is a large white water tower which acts as a landmark for miles around.The eastern sector consits of older private and council housing.As you move westwards this becomes 1960's private housing and in recent years there has been a huge explosion of new buildings covering many remaining woods and fields,smothering the old core village settlements of Tilehurst and Purley.
